problem_statement: $\text{We have a 12 unit square piece of thin material and want to make an open box by}$ $\text{cutting small squares from the corners and folding the sides up. Find the cut that produces}$ $\text{the box of maximum volume.}$
overview: $\text{We will model the volume of the box as a function of the cut length }x. \\ \text{Then, we will use differentiation to find the cut that produces}$ $\text{the maximum volume.}$
short_cuts: $\text{For optimization problems, we need to:}$ $\text{Define variable(s), Write function to optimize, Find critical points using } \displaystyle\frac{dV}{dx} = 0, \text{Test points for maximum}$

step_details.explanation: $\text{Let's start by defining our variables and understanding how they form the volume:}$
expressions: $\htmlClass{light_green_box_medium}{\text{Let }x = \text{ length of the cut on each side of the little squares}}$
$\htmlClass{light_red_box_medium}{\text{Let }V = \text{ the volume of the folded box}}$
${\text{Base length} = 12-2x} \quad \color{blue}{\text{(each side reduced by }2x\text{ from two cuts)}}$
$\htmlClass{light_yellow_box_medium}{V = x(12-2x)^2} \quad \color{blue}{\text{(volume as a function of cut length }x\text{)}}$

step_details.explanation: $\text{To find critical points, let's find }\displaystyle\frac{dV}{dx}\text{ using the product rule:}$
$\text{Let's analyze our critical points within our domain }(0,6)$
expressions: ${x = 2 \in (0,6)} \quad \color{blue}{\text{(this is our only valid critical point)}}$
$\displaystyle\frac{d^2V}{dx^2}\text{ changes from positive to negative at }x = 2$
